solution_line_template: At every passenger exchange there are {passengers_leaving} + {passengers_taking} = <<{passengers_leaving}+{passengers_taking}={total_passengers_per_exchange}>>{total_passengers_per_exchange} different people.

One hour is {minutes_per_hour} minutes, so during one hour, a train comes {minutes_per_hour} minutes/hour / {train_frequency_minutes} minutes/train = <<{minutes_per_hour}/{train_frequency_minutes}={trains_per_hour}>>{trains_per_hour} times.

So during one hour, {trains_per_hour} trains * {total_passengers_per_exchange} passengers/train = <<{trains_per_hour}*{total_passengers_per_exchange}={total_different_passengers}>>{total_different_passengers} different passengers step on and off the train.
